body: See #11296. This should be fixed. Can you repro on HEAD?

It is still so that following the instructions in INSTALL.md : 
```sh
 $ git clone -b $(curl -L http://grpc.io/release) https://github.com/grpc/grpc
 $ cd grpc
 $ git submodule update --init
 $ make
 $ [sudo] make install
```

Then it fails.
It is still so that if I do
```
git checkout master
git submodule update
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib LD_RUN_PATH=/usr/local/lib make
```

then it will work.

I understand that if I had installed c-ares-devel then this would not happen.
But I did not. And the instructions did not ask me to. And the c-ares that follows v1.4.1.x is clearly broken.

I do not understand what " Can you repro on HEAD?" means.

FYI, this also appears to fail on master for node.js with a similar error via `node-gyp`:
```
../src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.c:51:30: error: field ‘dns_server_addr’ has incomplete type
   struct ares_addr_port_node dns_server_addr;
                              ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
../src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.c: In function ‘grpc_dns_lookup_ares_impl’:
../src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.c:334:18: error: implicit declaration of function ‘ares_set_servers_ports’ [-Werror=implicit-function-declaration]
     int status = ares_set_servers_ports(*channel, &r->dns_server_addr);
                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
grpc.target.mk:386: recipe for target 'Release/obj.target/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.o' failed
make: *** [Release/obj.target/grpc/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/resolver/dns/c_ares/grpc_ares_wrapper.o] Error 1
```

I tried both with and without `libc-ares-dev` installed (on Ubuntu 17.04).

Of note, the `binding.gyp` has `GRPC_ARES=0` so I modified that to delete that and `GRPC_UV` to see if I could use cares at all, but got stuck on this compilation.
